alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:28AM CDT until April 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 AM CDT FOR HENRY...NORTHEASTERN VAN BUREN...SOUTHWESTERN LOUISA... SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...EASTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 328 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wayland to near Westwood to near Primrose, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... New London, Crawfordsville, Olds and Mount Pleasant Municipal Arpt around 335 AM CDT. Winfield, West Point, Mount Union, Wyman and Pollmiller Park around 340 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Columbus City, Lowell, Geode State Park and Stephenson Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
